other_tests.findings: Initial fMRI study showed right temporal activation with no activation over the left temporal lobe. The second fMRI revealed bilateral activation with left-sided predominance for language tasks.
other_tests.changes_over_time: First fMRI indicated right-sided activation; the follow-up demonstrated significant left-sided activation, confirming false lateralization in the initial study.

other_tests.findings: Increased radiopharmaceutical uptake in the entire left temporal lobe, operculum, and insula.
Interictal sharp/slow wave discharges over the left anterior quadrant, consistent with a left mesial temporal focus.
Confirmed language cortex localization over the left superior temporal gyrus.
